intro: Erdisia fortalezensis, commonly known as the Brazilian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
